Body: Description: Hi we have recently uploaded a new certificate to the Azure App used to authenticate for the SharePoint Job. Can you please assist as we are encountering the following error and want to go through the process and see that everything is configured correctly A configuration issue is preventing authentication - check the error message from the server for details. You can modify the configuration in the application registration portal. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-invalid-client for details. Original exception: AADSTS700027: The certificate with identifier used to sign the client assertion is not registered on application. [Reason - The key was not found., Thumbprint of key used by client: 'A2E87A83CD245A445802A18470F2DDA9B815C2A8', Please visit the Azure Portal, Graph Explorer or directly use MS Graph to see configured keys for app Id '7d26a2f1-e204-4203-9d45-b6ff0ea27b86'. Review the documentation at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/deployments to determine the corresponding service endpoint and https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/application-get?view=graph-rest-1.0&tabs=http to build a query request URL, such as 'https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/applications/7d26a2f1-e204-4203-9d45-b6ff0ea27b86']. Trace ID: bbc2b090-d573-4bf4-b35d-d502213b0000 Correlation ID: 88508f0c-9097-4248-a103-9f946059fb59 Timestamp: 2025-05-20 10:10:48Z

First guess is they replaced the certificate however the password in the connection profile credential needs to be updated to reflect the thumbprint. 

It's in the SharePoint online portion of this page. 
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/StealthAUDIT_11.5/page/Content/Configuration/SP_Online_Config/SPO_StealthAUDIT_Connection_Profile.htm
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Invitation updated. Attendees: Shaheryar Ali Tahir, Ilya Kotov, Stealth Audit
Invitation updated. Attendees: Shaheryar Ali Tahir, Ilya Kotov
Next Steps Updated: User will setup the azure app again and it should most likely resolve the issue.
What We've Learned Updated: Looks like the way they configured the azure app is not correct hence it was advised that they recreate the azure app and try again.
